Collection process for carbonaceous regolith from CM/CI chondrite impact sites.
Targets areas with visible dark material enrichment and organic compound signatures.
Rich in carbon (2-5%), water (10%), and volatiles - essential for ISRU operations.

recipe_def.notes: General purpose hand tool set for assembly and maintenance operations.

steps.notes: Sort and kit fasteners by size and type. Package in organized container with dividers for each size/type.

recipe_def.assumptions:
Assembles 1.0 kg fastener_kit_medium from pre-manufactured components per BOM.
Requires all components from bom_fastener_kit_medium_v0:
  - 0.720 kg bolt_hex_medium_steel
  - 0.180 kg nut_hex_medium_steel
  - 0.075 kg washer_flat_medium_steel
  - 0.030 kg washer_lock_medium_steel
Labor-intensive sorting and organization to create useful mixed kit.
recipe_def.notes:
Kit assembly recipe that combines individual fastener components into organized
mixed kit. Most commonly used kit in KB (107 BOMs reference this item).
Sorting ensures user can quickly find needed size without having to maintain
separate inventory of each fastener size.
Alternative production path: recipe_fastener_kit_small_v0 uses integrated
casting+machining+kitting approach without separate component recipes.

recipe_def.assumptions: Derived from excavation feed; coarse split via screening.

recipe_def.assumptions: Assumes regolith_coarse_fraction is available; mass is conserved to within placeholder losses.
recipe_def.notes: Initial, placeholder recipe to resolve no_recipe gap for coarse_powder.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for coarse powder

steps.notes: Ball mill powder mixture to reduce particle size and achieve uniform distribution; 2% loss as dust
Dry milled powder to remove moisture; ~3% moisture loss
Screen powder to achieve desired particle size distribution; final ceramic powder mixture

recipe_def.assumptions: Assumes coarse_powder feedstock from upstream ceramic mixing; ball milled, dried, and screened for uniform composition.
recipe_def.notes: Manufacturing of ceramic powder mixture from coarse_powder feedstock. Total processing time ~13 hours. Ball milling time dominates. Used for ceramic parts and refractory production.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for ceramic_powder_mixture

steps.notes: Form refractory crucible shape from ceramic mixture (clay-alumina, etc.)
Slow dry formed crucible to prevent cracking
Fire crucible at high temperature to vitrify and strengthen
Clean and inspect fired crucible

recipe_def.assumptions:
Refractory ceramic materials (e.g., clay-graphite or alumina) formed, dried, and fired.
Target mass ~15 kg.
recipe_def.notes:
Ceramic refractory crucible for high-temperature metal casting operations. This replaces the import placeholder with a local fabrication route.

Sequential flow: form  dry  fire  finish.

steps.notes: Process carbon/graphite powder with binder, hot press and sinter to form dense electrode blanks, machine to final dimensions with connection points, inspect dimensions and integrity

recipe_def.assumptions: Graphite/carbon construction formed from powder processing and sintering. High-temperature resistant for molten regolith electrolysis operations
recipe_def.notes: Fabrication of carbon/graphite electrodes for molten regolith electrolysis with high temperature operation capability

steps.notes: Extract carbon reductant from carbonaceous regolith feedstock.

recipe_def.assumptions: Carbonaceous regolith feedstock available for small-scale carbon recovery.
recipe_def.notes: ISRU extraction route for carbon reductant; drying and sizing steps deferred.

steps.notes: High-temperature heat treatment (2500-3000C) to convert amorphous carbon to crystalline graphite structure

recipe_def.assumptions:
Graphitization process converts disordered carbon from regolith into crystalline graphite.
Process requires inert atmosphere or vacuum and temperatures above 2500C.
Yields ~90% graphite powder with ~10% volatile loss (residual organics, moisture).
recipe_def.notes:
ISRU pathway for graphite powder production from regolith-derived carbon.
Enables local electrode and crucible production for lunar/Mars manufacturing.
Alternative to importing graphite from Earth.
recipe_def.name: Graphite powder from carbon reductant v0

steps.notes: Process carbon/graphite powder with binder, hot press and sinter to form dense electrode blanks, machine to final dimensions with connection points, inspect dimensions and integrity

recipe_def.assumptions: Graphite/carbon construction formed from powder processing and sintering. High-temperature resistant for molten regolith electrolysis operations

steps.notes: Convert ingot into 3mm steel sheet

recipe_def.assumptions: Assumes input ingot is steel and thickness target is 3mm.

recipe_def.name: Recipe for steel sheet 3mm

recipe_def.notes: Manufacture nickel metal, pure, via Mond carbonyl process. Placeholder parameters; mass balance provided by the Mond process.
recipe_def.name: Nickel metal, pure (Mond carbonyl) v0

recipe_def.notes: Single-step wire drawing from pure nickel to fine gauge; accounts for small losses as slag/dust.
recipe_def.name: Nickel wire, fine gauge (drawing)

recipe_def.notes: Basic recipe to transform nickel wire into a tube electrode set.

recipe_def.assumptions: Seed recipe; placeholder until BOM and downstream integration defined
recipe_def.notes: Seed recipe for nickel_anode_vacuum_tube_v0 using basic machining.
recipe_def.name: Nickel anode vacuum tube v0

recipe_def.notes: Fabricate tungsten cathode blank from tungsten powder via high temp sintering

steps.notes: Process tungsten powder with binder for cathode molding
Press tungsten powder into cathode blank shape
Sinter tungsten cathode at ~3000C to achieve dense, conductive structure
Machine cathode to final dimensions and add electrical connection point
Apply calcium oxide (CaO) coating to tungsten surface to reduce work function

recipe_def.assumptions: Critical thermionic converter component. Tungsten powder from NiFe meteorites, sintered at 3000C. CaO coating from anorthite extraction reduces work function from 4.5eV to ~2.0eV, dramatically improving thermionic emission. 100% lunar-manufacturable. See: design/solar_thermionics_report.md
recipe_def.notes: Production of CaO-coated tungsten cathode for thermionic power conversion. The CaO coating is critical for efficient electron emission at ~2000C operating temperature. Total fabrication time ~13 hours. Key component enabling 10-30% solar-to-electric conversion efficiency.
Fabricate shell for electrolysis_cell_unit_v0 from 25 kg steel_sheet_3mm; subsequent subassemblies added via downstream BOM/recipes.

steps.notes: Weld workbench frame from steel tubing or angle iron
Machine T-slots in table top, mount holes, leveling surfaces
Assemble frame, table top, leveling feet, mounting hardware

recipe_def.notes: Manufacturing of ceramic insulators. Total processing time ~19.5 hours. Critical for vacuum tube feedthroughs in thermionic power system.

recipe_def.notes: Comprehensive 13-step recipe covering steel processing, precision machining, ball/roller forming, heat treatment, assembly, lubrication, and testing. Suitable for 70-100mm bore heavy industrial bearings.

steps.notes: Hot roll steel ingot into bar or billet shapes

recipe_def.assumptions: Semi-finished steel product from hot rolling of ingots. Standard stock sizes for machining and forging feedstock.
recipe_def.notes: Production of steel bar and billet stock from ingots. Processing time ~1.5 hours per kg. ~5% loss to scale and trim.

steps.notes: Roll billet into bar stock

inputs.notes: Steel billet for rolling into bar stock

recipe_def.assumptions: Local production path; placeholder; replace with detailed BOM and routing as needed.
recipe_def.notes: Converted from import_stub to a local production path using the existing rolling process.
Placeholder recipe to manufacture bearing_ball_steel from steel_ingot; refine with full BOM.

steps.notes: Machine screw shaft with precision ball grooves, fabricate nut housing, assemble ball screw with recirculating ball bearings

recipe_def.assumptions: Ball screw assembly from stock bar with precision machining for linear motion systems
recipe_def.notes: Fabrication of precision ball screw assembly with nut for linear motion applications
recipe_def.name: Ball screw assembly fabrication v0

steps.notes: Hot or cold forge hex head from steel rod/wire stock. Forms head geometry in one or few blows.
Cut threads via thread rolling or turning. Finish shank length and chamfers. Thread rolling preferred for strength.

recipe_def.assumptions:
Generic bolt production for M6-M12 sizes. Process covers 2x size range.
Starting material: steel rod or wire stock (material_class: steel).
Thread rolling preferred over cutting for superior fatigue strength and surface finish.
Batch production typical: 50-100 bolts per setup for economy.
recipe_def.notes:
Standard hex bolt manufacturing using forging + machining. Forging creates net-shape or
near-net-shape head, machining creates precise threads and final dimensions. For high-volume
production, dedicated cold heading and thread rolling machines would be more efficient.

steps.notes: Cold heading to form hexagonal blank from steel rod, then drill and tap internal threads in continuous operation.

recipe_def.assumptions:
Generic hex nut production for M6-M12 sizes. Process covers 2x size range.
Starting material: steel rod or bar stock (material_class: steel).
Cold heading preferred for material efficiency and production speed.
Thread tapping standard for internal threads (thread rolling possible with specialized tooling).
recipe_def.notes:
Standard hex nut manufacturing. Cold heading creates hexagonal shape efficiently.
Tapping creates precise internal threads. For high-volume production, multi-station
nut formers can combine heading and tapping in continuous operation.
Recipe to manufacture steel sheet 1mm from ingot (uses sheet_making_from_ingot_1mm).
recipe_def.name: Recipe for steel sheet 1mm

steps.notes: Punch washers from steel sheet using progressive die. Outer diameter, inner hole, and edge chamfer in single or multi-stage operation.

recipe_def.assumptions:
Generic flat washer production for M6-M12 sizes. Process covers 2x size range.
Starting material: steel sheet 1-3mm thick (material_class: steel).
Progressive die stamping enables high-volume production with minimal scrap.
Scrap skeleton can be recycled for next batch.
recipe_def.notes:
Simple stamping operation for flat washers. Progressive or compound dies can produce
finished washers at high rates (hundreds per minute). Sheet thickness selected based on
washer size: M6-M8 uses ~1.5mm, M10-M12 uses ~2.5mm sheet.

steps.notes: Punch split ring lock washer from spring steel sheet. Creates helical gap for spring action.
Heat treat to develop spring properties. Quench and temper for hardness HRC 38-45 typical.

recipe_def.assumptions:
Generic lock washer production for M6-M12 sizes. Process covers 2x size range.
Starting material: spring steel sheet 1-2mm thick (material_class: steel, high carbon).
Heat treatment essential for spring function - must achieve proper hardness and resilience.
Split gap typically 1.5-2x wire thickness.
recipe_def.notes:
Split ring lock washer manufacturing requires spring steel and heat treatment.
Stamping creates the split ring geometry, heat treatment develops spring properties.
Alternative design: wave washers or toothed lock washers have different geometries
but serve similar anti-vibration function.

Collection process for carbonaceous regolith from CM/CI chondrite impact sites.
Targets areas with visible dark material enrichment and organic compound signatures.
Rich in carbon (2-5%), water (10%), and volatiles - essential for ISRU operations.

steps.notes: Cast fastener blanks and washer stock in batch molds
Machine threads and washer profiles from cast blanks
Heat treat fasteners for strength and spring properties
Inspect heat-treated fasteners for hardness and dimensional checks
Sort fasteners by size (M6, M8, M10, M12), count, and kit

recipe_def.assumptions:
Simplified fastener manufacturing from metal alloy bulk to finished kit:
- Cast blanks for bolts, nuts, and washers
- Machine threads and profiles
- Heat treat for strength and spring properties
- Final inspection and kitting

Input materials: 2.0 kg metal_alloy_bulk
Output: 1.0 kg complete fastener kit per BOM specification
Scrap rate: ~50% from casting/machining losses (conservative placeholder)
recipe_def.notes:
Simplified local recipe for fastener_kit_medium production.

Kit composition per bom_fastener_kit_medium_v0:
- 720g hex bolts M6-M12 in various lengths (76 pieces total)
- 180g hex nuts M6-M12 (135 pieces total)
- 75g flat washers M6-M12 (135 pieces total)
- 30g lock washers M6-M12 (60 pieces total)
Total: ~366 fasteners, 1.0 kg net weight

Manufacturing process details:
1. Casting: Form blanks for bolts, nuts, and washers
2. Threading: Cut external threads on bolts, tap nuts
3. Heat treatment: Quench and temper bolts to grade 8.8 equivalent, harden lock washers
4. Inspection: Verify hardness and dimensional checks
5. Kitting: Sort by size, verify counts, package in compartmented container
References detailed specification in design/memos/fastener_kit_specification.md
Most commonly used fastener kit in the KB (107 BOMs reference this item)
